properties.headline: Hard Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 1:05PM PST until February 4 at 10:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 20 to 30 mph with
gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the Hard Freeze Watch, sub-
freezing temperatures as low as 19 possible.

* WHERE...Apple and Lucerne Valleys.

* WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 4 PM this afternoon to
noon PST Monday. For the Hard Freeze Watch, from Monday evening
through Tuesday morning then again from Tuesday evening through
Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines.
Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially
for high profile vehicles along Interstate 15. Frost and freeze
conditions could damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing dust could reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
High winds could bring down power lines and tree branches. Use
caution if you must drive.

To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes
they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those
that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover
above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing. Take steps now
to protect tender plants from the cold.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON PST MONDAY... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
